result.execSummary:
The defendant Tara C. Perrault was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>50g), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees.*8
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program, or obtain GED or HSED during term of probation.  
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.**
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.**
**Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.**
Perform 100 hours of Community Service work for a public agency or non-profit charitable organization. May not have contact with Mr. Merritt or John Miller.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation

2:05 PM Defendant Tara C. Perrault in court, in custody.  Attorney William Paul Michel Ii in court for Tara C. Perrault.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.   Court imposes and stays 11 years WSP - 5 years IC and 6 years ES with conditions; DE placed on probation for 5 years with conditions; 282 days credit if revoked;  DE not eligible for CIP or SAP; bond in 21CF848 and 21CF904 applied to any fees/costs in this file;  DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge - notice given to DE in court. Appeal Rights, Federal Firearms Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
Character from Keith & Mary Lou Feichtner

ADDRESS INFO for Tara C. Perrault
Current: 4777 88th Avenue, KCDC, Kenosha, WI 53144 United States  (Effective: 08-05-2022)
Prior: 7801 88th Avenue, # 290, Pleasant Prairie, WI 53158

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michel.   Clerk HMcBride.  On state's motion, cts 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 are DRI.  DE enters guilty plea to ct 1.  Court finds DE guilty of ct 1.  PSI ordered.  SEH 10/26 2pm.  Bond continued.

04:37 PM  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. DE appears by Zoom with Atty William Michel. HYRBID HEARING.  Clerk P. Scypta.  
MINUTES:  DE intends to enter a plea, though Court is experiencing audio issues. Matter set over for in person appearance by DE.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
10:57 AM      NO RECORD MADE. Hearing rescheduled at the request of Atty Michel prior to Court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Tara C. Perrault appeared with Attorney William Paul Michel.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 1.  Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Branch 1 Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

108PM  State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney William Michel.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on April 29, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Bond continued.  Conditions as previously set.  kmk
DE re: appt of atty
At 4/11 hearing in files 21CF904 and 21CF848 - court appts Atty Michel for DE in this file.

(No CD time)  State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Bond continued as previously set.  Amended complaint acknowledged by Deft.  Deft attempting to retain attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PE for Appt of Atty not approved. Clerk attempted to reach DE using number on PE but was advised that number did not belong to DE.   - - VM left for DE 3/11 and order placed in pro se pick up bin/204.

02:20 PM  Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.  Bond continued.  Conditions as previously set.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing.  Advocate counsel in review with Br.1.  kmk
to appt counsel (sent to br.1)
